commands.name: az functionapp config set
commands.summary: Set an existing function app's configuration.
commands.syntax:
az functionapp config set [--always-on {false, true}]
                          [--auto-heal-enabled {false, true}]
                          [--ftps-state {AllAllowed, Disabled, FtpsOnly}]
                          [--generic-configurations]
                          [--http20-enabled {false, true}]
                          [--ids]
                          [--java-container]
                          [--java-container-version]
                          [--java-version]
                          [--linux-fx-version]
                          [--min-tls-version]
                          [--name]
                          [--net-framework-version]
                          [--number-of-workers]
                          [--php-version]
                          [--powershell-version]
                          [--prewarmed-instance-count]
                          [--python-version]
                          [--remote-debugging-enabled {false, true}]
                          [--resource-group]
                          [--slot]
                          [--startup-file]
                          [--subscription]
                          [--use-32bit-worker-process {false, true}]
                          [--vnet-route-all-enabled {false, true}]
                          [--web-sockets-enabled {false, true}]
examples: az functionapp config set --always-on true --name MyFunctionApp --resource-group MyResourceGroup
az functionapp config set -g MyResourceGroup -n MyFunctionApp --generic-configurations "@.\params.json"

commands.name: az functionapp config show
commands.summary: Get the details of an existing function app's configuration.
examples: az functionapp config show --name MyFunctionApp --resource-group MyResourceGroup
